bow: stop acting like bouncing back from labor is even possible seriously had to go back to work two weeks after had my son chef not cush deskjob and two years later still paying for it freakin tired yes this article nails it was alone with my lo week and half after we got home from the hospital remember telling the docs could walk had larger than normal section incision because had an enormous baby yet but they still rushed me out of the hospital and nobody would see me until my week followup it was miserable they told me not to drive or walk up the stairs unaided for weeks yet was home alone with baby could barely carry and family members few visited but none really helped out acted like was whiny or needy for not being able to do everything immediately the next time have child going to sit on the couch or in bed for at least week not going to cook and not going to clean and not going to go out for some reason with my first child thought needed to get back to normal as soon as possible when what really should have done was rested maybe it would have made breastfeeding little easier too was in the same boat they removed buddha himself from me and then weeks later was on mom duty alone felt incredibly sad angry guilty and frustrated that could hold him unless was sitting down knew it would be hard after birth but nothing read really prepared me for how hard and know was lucky to have pretty routine vaginal birth the pressure on women is ridiculous haha buddha himself mine was 24 long so notsomuch buddha but the nurses kept calling him the toddler also could make enough to ebf and 11 and half pound baby so there was all that guilt heaped on top with every other mom an expert insisting was doing it wrong if have another one and am as wrecked as the first one left me am going to seriously consider hiring part time nanny for the first month seriously considering adoption if we decide on next one the pregnancy and birthing was breeze the recovery was really traumatic for me can not go through that again it worth noting that that not so much being expected to bounce back from labor but to bounce back from *major abdominal surgery* that anyone would treat you as self sufficient after only week is horrendous yes all of this the comments on this article are good for the most part too the idea of pp mom cleaning for visitors pisses me off you should step foot in their house without some food to give in your hand or an offer to do chore or two yeah that too it as if section is seen as the easy way out and moms who choose it in my case it was the best option for the health of me and my baby somehow are overlooked as recuperating patients do know how women do it with out help luckily my so was randomly off work for two weeks after gave birth and if he was would have gone insane had regular vaginal birth but tore in three different spots it took the doc three times to stitch me up all the way as in stitched unstitched stitched up just cant figure out why you re still bleeding unstitched stitched up all the way thank the lord for my epidural could walk for longer than about 30 minutes around the house with out the pressure down there being unbearable something needs to be fixed about this crap nailed it was back at school days after having my daughter if did go back would have been kicked out of the program but would still have been charged for it did end up using the certification and just continued to be stay at home mom why does america expect women to pop out baby and resume life with in days thank god that as near the end of my third pregnancy know that will get the much needed rest for the two weeks my husband is home ughh seriously my eyelid started twitching when got to their story on the tabloids coverage of jessica simpson weight loss battles she had her *second section less than two months ago who the fuck is doing crunches after major abdominal surgery emergency section only recovery had was the days in the hospital came home took care of baby cooking cleaning completely alone back to work in weeks that what did with my second bfing did go well with my first one so hubby took weeks off and layed in bed and nursed read stories to my first nursed some more sometimes if nurse on the couch it was nice and it worked little nugget is still ebf same here with my second it was completely different story with my first was up washing laundry trying to be super mom which lasted for about 36 hours before crashed with the second did change out of my sweats and into regular clothes until around weeks this completely validates how felt after having my son my pelvis was not happy with me and it caused lot of pain getting in and out of bed and lingering sciatica made carrying him downstairs to nurse an ordeal cried thinking would never be able to have another baby but if had someone like those mexican mothers to help me limit my walking into my ligaments recovered that would have made it so much easier deleted after my first was on call throughout my unpaid leave from work conducted meetings over the phone went in for meetings and worked from home all while not being paid dime my voluntary short term disability claimed that they were told my salary was of what it actually was so lost thousands of dollars that were rightfully mine went back to work after weeks after my second which gave birth to 11 months after my first she was surprise took eight weeks off had complications high blood pressure and my baby was premature again on call at work with no pay again the short term disability claimed they could pay me what really made because even though had gone out of my way to submit paperwork proving that had gotten significant raises years before and deserved more money apparently the have to have that for year before they raise the amount they will pay you they stopped paying me at six weeks even though took eight weeks off and had basically just been pregnant for two years straight wonder if it would be possible to change the attitude toward new mothers on community level instead of relying on our employers or insurance companies to help us out maybe we can be more present and helpful to each other totally agree with your last statement while it would be nice if our employers and insurance would get reality check in the meantime we need to stop with this incessant judgement on each other and just support other moms hate it when hear people sniping about breast feeding vs formula or how lazy sahm mom is how removed working mom is etc we are all moms we are all people who should support the reasonable and rational decisions others make and just be there as community how do you managing still meeting the needs of your first child wish had read this before and thinking too could do it all for just week probably with the help of his dad and grandmother or two you know this article really voices how have felt about the entire thing for long time actually felt *guilty* for not having the house sparkling clean for when my husband family came to visit felt *guilty* for wanting to sleep all day and not having anything cooked when my husband came home was in city with no family no friends with only my husband to rely on and he was incredibly lucky to have been off for days after my son came and he was off meaning the facility was closed because he did receive any time off was eligible for maternity leave so lost my job it was horrible time and horrible memory my husband is terrified of having more kids because he remembers how awful it was we re in better financial position and we have family surrounding us now but it was such dark time that he wo consider having second kid sorry this ended up more as rant than comment on the did too thank you so much feel the hug and squeeze you back tighter and as for cooking and cleaning would let you even with all the labor pain and not getting any help after the birth have to say that
